intro: Jacquinia longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shady to partially sunny conditions. Its leaves are elongated and often have a waxy surface, while its flowers are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Jacquinia longifolia is often found in wetlands, pine forests, and other moist habitats.
